member.name: T:System.Net.HttpListenerRequest
member.summary: Describes an incoming HTTP request to an object.
member.remarks:
When a client makes a request to a Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) handled by an HttpListener object, the HttpListener provides an object that contains information about the sender, the request, and the response that is sent to the client. The property returns the HttpListenerRequest object that describes the request.
The HttpListenerRequest object contains information about the request, such as the request string, string, and request body data (see the
property).
To reply to the request, you must get the associated response using the property.

member.name: T:System.Net.HttpStatusCode
member.summary: Contains the values of status codes defined for HTTP.

remarks.p: Status codes indicate categories, as follows:

members.member: Informational -- 1xx. Equivalent to HTTP status 100. Indicates that the client can continue with its request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SwitchingProtocols
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 101. Indicates that the protocol version or protocol is being changed.

members.member: Successful -- 2xx. Equivalent to HTTP status 200. Indicates that the request succeeded and that the requested information is in the response. This is the most common status code to receive.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Created
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 201. Indicates that the request resulted in a new resource created before the response was sent.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Accepted
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 202. Indicates that the request has been accepted for further processing.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NonAuthoritativeInformation
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 203. Indicates that the returned metainformation is from a cached copy instead of the origin server and therefore may be incorrect.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NoContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 204. Indicates that the request has been successfully processed and that the response is intentionally blank.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ResetContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 205. Indicates that the client should reset (not reload) the current resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PartialContent
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 206. Indicates that the response is a partial response as requested by a GET request that includes a byte range.

members.member:
Redirection -- 3xx. Equivalent to HTTP status 300. Indicates that the requested information has multiple representations. The default action is to treat this status as a redirect and follow the contents of the Location header associated with this response.
If the property is false, MultipleChoices will cause an exception to be thrown.
MultipleChoices is a synonym for Ambiguous.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Ambiguous
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 300. Indicates that the requested information has multiple representations. The default action is to treat this status as a redirect and follow the contents of the Location header associated with this response.
If the property is false, Ambiguous will cause an exception to be thrown.
Ambiguous is a synonym for MultipleChoices.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MovedPermanently
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 301. Indicates that the requested information has been moved to the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response.
MovedPermanently is a synonym for Moved.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Moved
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 301. Indicates that the requested information has been moved to the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.
Moved is a synonym for MovedPermanently.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Found
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 302. Indicates that the requested information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.
If the property is false, Found will cause an exception to be thrown.
Found is a synonym for Redirect.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Redirect
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 302. Indicates that the requested information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will use the GET method.
If the property is false, Redirect will cause an exception to be thrown.
Redirect is a synonym for Found.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.SeeOther
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 303. Automatically redirects the client to the URI specified in the Location header as the result of a POST. The request to the resource specified by the Location header will be made with a GET.
If the property is false, SeeOther will cause an exception to be thrown.
SeeOther is a synonym for RedirectMethod.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectMethod
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 303. Automatically redirects the client to the URI specified in the Location header as the result of a POST. The request to the resource specified by the Location header will be made with a GET.
If the property is false, RedirectMethod will cause an exception to be thrown.
RedirectMethod is a synonym for SeeOther.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotModified
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 304. Indicates that the client's cached copy is up-to-date. The contents of the resource are not transferred.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UseProxy
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 305. Indicates that the request should use the proxy server at the URI specified in the Location header.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unused
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 306. This value is a proposed extension to the HTTP/1.1 specification that is not fully specified.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.TemporaryRedirect
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 307. Indicates that the request information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will also use the POST method.
If the property is false, TemporaryRedirect will cause an exception to be thrown.
TemporaryRedirect is a synonym for RedirectKeepVerb.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RedirectKeepVerb
member.summary:
Equivalent to HTTP status 307. Indicates that the request information is located at the URI specified in the Location header. The default action when this status is received is to follow the Location header associated with the response. When the original request method was POST, the redirected request will also use the POST method.
If the property is false, RedirectKeepVerb will cause an exception to be thrown.
RedirectKeepVerb is a synonym for TemporaryRedirect.

members.member: Client Error -- 4xx. Equivalent to HTTP status 400. Indicates that the request could not be understood by the server. BadRequest is sent when no other error is applicable, or if the exact error is unknown or does not have its own error code.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Unauthorized
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 401. Indicates that the requested resource requires authentication. The WWW-Authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PaymentRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 402. Reserved for future use.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Forbidden
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 403. Indicates that the server refuses to fulfill the request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotFound
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 404. Indicates that the requested resource does not exist on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.MethodNotAllowed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 405. Indicates that the request method (POST or GET) is not allowed on the requested resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotAcceptable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 406. Indicates that the client has indicated with Accept headers that it will not accept any of the available representations of the resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ProxyAuthenticationRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 407. Indicates that the requested proxy requires authentication. The Proxy-authenticate header contains the details of how to perform the authentication.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 408. Indicates that the client did not send a request within the time the server was expecting the request.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Conflict
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 409. Indicates that the request could not be carried out because of a conflict on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.Gone
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 410. Indicates that the requested resource is no longer available.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.LengthRequired
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 411. Indicates that the required Content-length header is missing.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.PreconditionFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 412. Indicates that a condition set for this request failed, and the request cannot be carried out. Conditions are set with conditional request headers like If-Match, If-None-Match, or If-Unmodified-Since.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestEntityTooLarge
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 413. Indicates that the request is too large for the server to process.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestUriTooLong
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 414. Indicates that the URI is too long.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.UnsupportedMediaType
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 415. Indicates that the request is an unsupported type.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.RequestedRangeNotSatisfiable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 416. Indicates that the range of data requested from the resource cannot be returned, either because the beginning of the range is before the beginning of the resource, or the end of the range is after the end of the resource.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ExpectationFailed
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 417. Indicates that an expectation given in an Expect header could not be met by the server.

members.member: Server Error -- 5xx. Equivalent to HTTP status 500. Indicates that a generic error has occurred on the server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.NotImplemented
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 501. Indicates that the server does not support the requested function.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.BadGateway
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 502. Indicates that an intermediate proxy server received a bad response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.ServiceUnavailable
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 503. Indicates that the server is temporarily unavailable, usually due to high load or maintenance.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.GatewayTimeout
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 504. Indicates that an intermediate proxy server timed out while waiting for a response from another proxy or the origin server.

member.name: F:System.Net.HttpStatusCode.HttpVersionNotSupported
member.summary: Equivalent to HTTP status 505. Indicates that the requested HTTP version is not supported by the server.

property.

member.summary: Closes the response stream.
member.remarks: The method closes the response stream and releases the connection to the resource for reuse by other requests. You should not access any properties of the object after the call to the method. You must call either the or the method to close the stream and release the connection for reuse. It is not necessary to call both and , but doing so does not cause an error. Failure to close the stream can cause your application to run out of connections.

The content of the header that is being added (its header-value). If a header with the specified name already exists, this value is concatenated onto the existing header.
member.remarks:
If a header with the specified name already exists, the header that is being added is concatenated onto the existing header.
Throws an exception if the specified header name is the name of a special header.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Inserts a new header into the collection.
member.param: A header name/value pair, in the format "myHeaderName:myValue".
member.remarks:
This method expects a string with the format "myName:myValue", and parses the two parts out.
If a header with the specified name already exists, the header that is being added is concatenated onto the existing header.
Throws an exception if the specified header name is the name of a special header.

member.remarks: Throws an exception if the specified header name is the name of a special header.

member.name: M:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.GetValues(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the values for the specified header name.
member.returns: An array of parsed string objects.
member.remarks:
Takes a header name and returns a string array representing the individual values for that header. For example, if the headers contain the following line:
Accept: text/plain, text/html
then GetValues("Accept") returns an array of two strings: "text/plain" and "text/html".

member.name: M:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.ToString
member.summary: Generates a string representation of the headers, that is ready to be sent except for it being in String format.
member.returns: A string representation of the headers.
member.remarks:
The format looks like the following:
Header-Name: Header-Value
 Header-Name2: Header-Value2
 ... Header-NameN: Header-ValueN

member.name: M:System.Net.WebHeaderCollection.ToByteArray
member.summary: Generates a byte array representation of the headers, that is ready to be sent.
member.returns: An array of bytes.
member.remarks:
This method serializes the headers into a byte array that can be sent over the network. The format looks like:
Header-Name1: Header-Value1
 Header-Name2: Header-Value2
 ... Header-NameN: Header-ValueN

member.name: T:System.Net.InputNetworkStreamWrapper
member.summary: The InputNetworkStreamWrapper is used to re-implement calls to NetworkStream.Read It has internal buffer and during initial read operation it places available data from socket into buffer. Later it releases data to Stream.Read calls. It also provides direct access to bufferet data for internal code. It provides possibility to "unread" or probe data - meaning user can read byte of data and then return it back to stream.

The host name specified in is not valid.
The file name specified in is not valid.
The user name specified in is not valid.
The host or authority name specified in cannot be terminated by backslashes.
The port number specified in is not valid or cannot be parsed.

member.summary: Internal method parses a URI string into Uri variables

member.name: M:System.Uri.ParseSchemeSpecificPart(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Parse Scheme-specific part of uri for host, port and absolute path Briefed syntax abstracted from .NET FX: Group 1 - http, https, ftp, file, gopher, nntp, telnet, ldap, net.tcp and net.pipe Must be rooted. The 1st segment is authority. Empty path should be replace as '/'
Group 2 - file Reminder: Treat all '\' as '/' If it starts with only one '/', host should be empty Otherwise, all leading '/' should be ignored before searching for 1st segment. The 1st segment is host
Group 3 - news and uuid Authority always be empty. Everything goes to path.
Group 4 - mailto and all other shemes The 1st segment is authority iff it was not rooted.
Group 5 - all other schemes The 1st segment is authority iff it was rooted. Empty path should be replace as '/'
